Detailed Description

Structure representing timeout.

This structure is used by client applications when receiving messages from the server.

Definition at line 19 of file Timeout.h.

Member Function Documentation

TC2API void timeout_init ( Timeout *  timeout,
uint  nSeconds 
)

Initializes a Timeout structure.

Parameters:
timeout : the Timeout structure to be initialized.
[in] nSeconds : number of seconds until timeout occurs. If 0 timeout always occurs, if (unsigned)-1 timeout never occurs.

Definition at line 63 of file Timeout.c.

00064 {
00065    time_t now;
00066    uint elapsed;
00067 
00068    // has timeout been configured to always expire?
00069    if (!timeout->nSeconds)
00070       return 0; // yes, so timeout expired
00071 
00072    // has timeout been configured to never expire ?
00073    if (timeout->nSeconds == TIMEOUT_WAIT_FOREVER)
00074       return TIMEOUT_WAIT_FOREVER; // yes, so timeout did not expire
00075 
00076    // now, checks the elapsed time
00077 
00078    now = time(NULL);
00079    elapsed = (uint)(now - timeout->start);
00080 
00081    // has timeout expired ?
00082    if (elapsed >= timeout->nSeconds)
00083       return 0; // yes, timeout expired
00084 
00085    // no, timeout did not expire
00086    return timeout->nSeconds - elapsed;
00087 }
